How to use THE KLAW:

Step 1: Arm that sucker. It's never gonna grab a thing if it isn't ready!

Step 2: Get close to whatever object you wish to grab, be it plucky intern, spacecraft, asteroid, the ground, your sack lunch for later in the day, etc.

Step 3: Gently get closer to your intern/spacecraft/asteroid/ground/sandwich until the klaw's mystical powers activate and it attaches to your favorite object.

Step 4: Now that you have your object in your clutches, feel free to do whatever you want with it. Maybe that intern will learn a thing once he experiences re-entry firsthand.

Step 5 (ASTEROIDS ONLY!!): Once you have grabbed your favorite/most attractive asteroid, right click it and select "Target Center of Mass". Oh, you can also re-name it. Maybe you can name it George and love it and hug him and pet him.

Step 6 (ASTEROIDS ONLY!!): Right click on THE KLAW and select "free pivot". This allows you to rotate your spacecraft (mostly) independently from your asteroid. Rotate your spaceship until the heading marker and the target marker are aligned.

Step 7 (ASTEROIDS ONLY!!): Right click THE KLAW again, and select "lock pivot". You may have to free the pivot again and rotate again, as it can take a few tries to get the heading marker and the target marker aligned as close as possible.

Step 8 (ASTEROIDS ONLY!!): By now, your heading and your target marker should be in-line, which means that if you thrust, your new pet asteroid named George will not spiral madly out of control. Feel free to do whatever you'd like with it now.

are there any beefy robotic arms or servos to use in mods?

Yes.

Check out Romfarer's Robotic Arms Pack.

Description:

"This pack contains two replicas of real life robotic arms used space. The CanadArm2 from the ISS and the Buran manipulator from the shuttle with the same name. The arms comes with a camera attached to the tip of the arm. This interface is also the one you will use to move the arm around. In order to grab other vessels both arms are equipped by a magnet. Whenever you grab something both vessels will automatically dock with eachother. This is necessary in order to be able to save and load properly. The arms are also warp capable, with and without load. Keep in mind that the arms can not handle excessive loads within a gravity field. Accelleration is also not reccommended. And finally, the arm will produce force according to newtonian laws, if you experience too much wobble, use the slow speed setting. This can be activated with the CAPSLOCK key."

Does that actually work? I know the claw won't grab the surface of planets/moons but I've never tried it with a building.

Honestly, I was just cracking wise. Give it a try!
